alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 3:24PM CDT until September 09 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Monroe County in east Tennessee... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area and only slowly moving northwest. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Radar estimated one to two inches have occurred in the past hour with another one inch possible in the next two hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tellico Plains and Mount Vernon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
